text: Chen Ailian (; 24 December 1939 – 21 November 2020) was a Chinese dancer. In 1952 she became a student at Central Academy of Drama (中央戏剧学院) in Beijing. In 1963 she became a major trouper in China Opera and Dance-Drama Theatre. She once acted the leading role in the first performance of pantomime Fish-Beauty (《鱼美人》) in 1959.Lu Wenjian. Chen Ailian, Encyclopedia of China (Music&Dance; Edition), 1st ed.
